messages: b844a0a98f81c321afe1d38ae37f3c28 (13:54): channel #whatwg

25812bf456959aa5f28dc570f341a3ba (13:54): is 'WHATWG: http://www.whatwg.org/ -- logs: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/ -- stats: http://gavinsharp.com/irc/whatwg.html -- Please leave your sense of logic at the door, thanks!'
5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b (13:54): by annevk42 on Mon Oct 19 23:03:06
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (13:56): anyone know what ‚Äúthe URL given as the item type should not be automatically dereferenced‚Äù or ‚ÄúItem types are opaque identifiers‚Äù means? #microdata
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (13:57): remembers irc isn‚Äôt twitter
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:03): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: It means they should be treated as meaningless strings, not as URLs
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:03): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: so what‚Äôs the point of them then?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:04): They use the URL mechanism to provide global uniqueness
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:05): The URL might point to a 404, which is fine

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:06): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I kinda thought that as microdata is machine-readable a program could theoretically reference the itemid to learn about a new vocabulary, but that seems forbidden. how does that affect machine readibility
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:06): though it shouldn't point to a non-existent domain because there's nothing to stop someone else picking the same non-existent domain
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:07): You can parse microdata without needing to know the vocabulary
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:07): (which is probably its main benefit over microformats)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:08): and I don't think there were compelling use cases for writing tools that process parsed data from vocabularies they know nothing about
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:08): Non-dereferencable URLs is probably the most futile effort ever
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:09): so it wasn't considered important to support that

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:10): I was asking Manu about microdata vocabularies and heard that RDFa vocabs can be used (with URLs as names) but that microdata vocabularies have to be defined in spec. that 2nd part doesn‚Äôt seem right because e.g. Google‚Äôs data-vocabulary.org vocabs
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:11): http://twitter.com/manusporny
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:11): microdata vocabs can be defined independently right?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:11): Yup.
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:12): Yes, as long as you specify them somewhere
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:12): huh. was wondering if i was missing something there for a while :)
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:12): It's just authoring conformance, it doesn't actually matter in processing
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:12): wonder why he said that

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:13): As far as I'm aware, you can define microdata vocabularies however you want and write machine-readable versions in whatever format you want and then code them into your microdata-using application and associate them with the item type identifier
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:14): so that‚Äôs why you can use RDFa vocabs too huh

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): I think RDFa is designed to tie in with RDFish ways of defining vocabularies; microdata is designed to not care about that problem and merely to provide a tree of data that you can interpret however you want
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:17): now wondering how to write dereferenced URL in a way that normal ppl would understand :) a uniqueness token? hmm
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:18): Dereferenced URL?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:18): That's just a resource :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:18): (unless you're an HTTP person in which case it's a representation)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:19): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: heh, I‚Äôd say that‚Äôs still a little too metaphysical for html5doctor readers ;)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:19): Do you mean something like non-dereferenceable URL instead?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:20): eg ‚ÄúNote that the URL is only a unique vocabulary identifier ‚Äî it doesn‚Äôt actually have to have any content‚Äù
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:20): Maybe it'd be best to give examples
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:20): (URL being the value of itemtype="")
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:21): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: Well, it _may_ be dereferencable
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:21): like say it can be "http://n.whatwg.org/whatever" even though there's not a page (or even a domain) there
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:21): Just not necessarily

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:22): and say that's a completely different item type from "http://n.whatwg.org/whatever/" since they're different strings even if they might happen to be equivalent when used as URLs
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:23): or something like that

4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:26): "note that the URL is only a unique vocabulary identifier. Some vocabularies may use URLs that go somewhere, but for microdata purposes it's just a string with no special meaning ("opaque identifier").

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:28): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: The URLs are compared as strings. The resembelence to URLs you use to access resources on the web is either a) useful or b) dangerously misleading, depending on your point of view
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:28): 4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b: thanks for the suggestion
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:28): It could be useful because the URL could point to some human-readable text explaining how to use the vocabulary
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:29): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: hehe, that seems to define a lot of HTML5 huh
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:29): yeah that‚Äôs what Google vocabularies do, except for recipe
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:29): It could be dangrously misleading because you might think that http://foo.example and http://foo.example/ were the same
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:30): But they are not (since there is only string comparison)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:30): The reason that UAs must not automatically deference the URLs is that this constitutes a DDOS attack
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:30): i kind of feel that‚Äôs edge case, as most users will reuse vocabs, and those that make them will probably know about this
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:31): (see also: doctype URLs)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:31): aah good point
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:31): See also: People editing doctype URLs to "customize"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: The danger is that a user might use some vocabulary that defines http://example.com and write http://example.com/ instead
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): and be confused when noting works
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:32): (or not notice, but have wasted their time)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:33): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: so both useful and dangerously misleading then?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:33): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: And verbose. Let's not forget that :)
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:33): The counterargument to useful is that you could just google the URL anyhow :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:34): (verbose is the reason that RDFa defines prefixing mechanisms. But that turns out to be even worse)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:34): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: well not a big deal per itemid, but certainly if you‚Äôre using URLs for itemprop names
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:34): oh, being summoned
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:34): I shall return presently
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (14:34): thanks for your input all
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:35): worries that 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f might be some sort of demonic being
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (14:37): WTF,since when did cmd+l open the Go-to-page dialog in Opera / Mac rather than focusing the URL bar?
4d2a769942601baa26f55634a8eb251b (14:40): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: You seem to be writing W3 instead of W3C
